citation.article-title: Rearrangements of the species and genera of the phototrophic "purple nonsulfur bacteria."

p.s: Description of genus Rhodomicrobium Duchow and Douglas 1949.
Type species: Rhodomicrobium vannielii Duchow and Douglas 1949.
Cells are ovoid, motile by peritrichous flagella, multiply by budding, and have intracytoplasmic membranes parallel to the cytoplasmic membrane.

Despite its similarity to Rhodopseudomonas viridis and Rhodopseudomonas acidophila with regard to cytochrome c2 structure and 16s rRNA oligonucleotide composition, the genus Rhodomicrobium is maintained because of its characteristic morphological properties; these are peritrichous flagellation of the swarmer cells, the stalk, and exospore formation.

Additional characteristics are the presence of unusual polar lipids, which are similar to those of Rhodopila globiformis, and the differences from Rhodopseudomonas and Rhodobacter based on DNA-rRNA hybridization studies.
